message:
I am interacting with the MCP server with name:
```
create_pr
```
and arguments:
```
{'repo_name': 'sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes', 'source_branch': 'feat/code-review-cycle-microagent', 'target_branch': 'main', 'title': 'feat: Add code review cycle microagent', 'body': '## Description

This PR adds a new microagent for handling iterative code review cycles. The microagent provides guidance for:

1. **Systematic Review Process**: After creating a PR and marking it ready to review, wait 5 minutes for Google Code Assist and other agents to provide feedback
2. **Retry Mechanism**: If no comments are received after 5 minutes, wait 5 more minutes and try one last time
3. **Comprehensive Comment Addressing**: Thoroughly review and implement all feedback from code reviews
4. **Cycle Management**: Close the current PR and open a new one to trigger fresh reviews
5. **Maximum Iterations**: Repeat the cycle for a maximum of 10 iterations

## Changes Made

- Created `.openhands/microagents/code-review-cycle.md` with comprehensive documentation
- Implements the code review cycle workflow as specified
- Follows repository conventions and testing requirements

## Testing

- [x] Microagent file created with proper YAML frontmatter and markdown content
- Follows existing microagent structure and format

## Purpose

This microagent complements the existing PR Ready to Review and SheepVibes Rules microagents
- Provides structured guidance for automated code review processes
- Ensures proper handling of review comments and iterative improvements

## Related Issues

- N/A

## Notes

- Follows all repository testing requirements and validation workflows
- Ensures code quality by running full test suite before each PR creation', 'draft': 'false', 'labels': 'enhancement,documentation'}
```

arguments.title: feat: Add code review cycle microagent
arguments.body:
## Description

This PR adds a new microagent for handling iterative code review cycles. The microagent provides guidance for:

1. **Systematic Review Process**: After creating a PR and marking it ready to review, wait 5 minutes for Google Code Assist and other agents to provide feedback
2. **Retry Mechanism**: If no comments are received after 5 minutes, wait 5 more minutes and try one last time
3. **Comprehensive Comment Addressing**: Thoroughly review and implement all feedback from code reviews
4. **Cycle Management**: Close the current PR and open a new one to trigger fresh reviews
5. **Maximum Iterations**: Repeat the cycle for a maximum of 10 iterations

## Changes Made

- Created `.openhands/microagents/code-review-cycle.md` with comprehensive documentation
- Implements the code review cycle workflow as specified
- Follows repository conventions and testing requirements

## Testing

- [x] Microagent file created with proper YAML frontmatter and markdown content
- Follows existing microagent structure and format

## Purpose

This microagent complements the existing PR Ready to Review and SheepVibes Rules microagents
- Provides structured guidance for automated code review processes
- Ensures proper handling of review comments and iterative improvements

## Related Issues

- N/A

## Notes

- Follows all repository testing requirements and validation workflows
- Ensures code quality by running full test suite before each PR creation

The microagent provides guidance for:\n\n1. **Systematic Review Process**: After creating a PR and marking it ready to review, wait 5 minutes for Google Code Assist and other agents to provide feedback\n2. **Retry Mechanism**: If no comments are received after 5 minutes, wait 5 more minutes and try one last time\n3. **Comprehensive Comment Addressing**: Thoroughly review and implement all feedback from code reviews\n4. **Cycle Management**: Close the current PR and open a new one to trigger fresh reviews\n5. **Maximum Iterations**: Repeat the cycle for a maximum of 10 iterations\n\n## Changes Made\n\n- Created `.openhands/microagents/code-review-cycle.md` with comprehensive documentation\n- Implements the code review cycle workflow as specified\n- Follows repository conventions and testing requirements\n\n## Purpose\n\nThis microagent complements the existing PR Ready to Review and SheepVibes Rules microagents\n- Provides structured guidance for automated code review processes\n- Ensures proper handling of review comments and iterative improvements\n\n## Testing\n\n- [x] Microagent file created with proper YAML frontmatter and markdown content\n- Follows existing microagent structure and format"
", "security_risk": "LOW"}

args.command:
curl -X POST -H "Authorization: token $GITHUB_TOKEN" \
-H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls \
-d '{
  "title": "feat: Add code review cycle microagent",
  "head": "feat/code-review-cycle-microagent",
  "base": "main",
  "body": "## Description

This PR adds a new microagent for handling iterative code review cycles. The microagent provides guidance for:

1. **Systematic Review Process**: After creating a PR and marking it ready to review, wait 5 minutes for Google Code Assist and other agents to provide feedback
2. **Retry Mechanism**: If no comments are received after 5 minutes, wait 5 more minutes and try one last time
3. **Comprehensive Comment Addressing**: Thoroughly review and implement all feedback from code reviews
4. **Cycle Management**: Close the current PR and open a new one to trigger fresh reviews
5. **Maximum Iterations**: Repeat the cycle for a maximum of 10 iterations

## Changes Made

- Created `.openhands/microagents/code-review-cycle.md` with comprehensive documentation
- Implements the code review cycle workflow as specified
- Follows repository conventions and testing requirements

## Purpose

This microagent complements the existing PR Ready to Review and SheepVibes Rules microagents
- Provides structured guidance for automated code review processes
- Ensures proper handling of review comments and iterative improvements

## Testing

- [x] Microagent file created with proper YAML frontmatter and markdown content
- Follows existing microagent structure and format"
